result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Brian Van Ells is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Courts Office.
Initial appearance on May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:43 AM Defendant Kia'Treveon Edward James Ford appeared by video.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant wishes to submit Petition for Court Appointed Counsel. The Petition was returned indicating that additional information was needed. 
The matter is adjourned.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:00 am - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kia'Treveon Edward James Ford appeared by video. Not eligible for PD.  Want to complete PFAC forms.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 03-17-22 at 10:30 a.m.   Bail is set at $750.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety as to illegal substances and no possession of weapons.   Bond mailed to defendant.
